metaData.description: Accommodation in a restored heritage house from the Historic Center. Hiking or bike trails along the roman galleries, gold mining areas, heritage buildings, mountains, lakes. Rent bikes or guided tours. At the end of the day read a book from our library in the hammock. Rosia Montana, Alba, Apuseni Mountains, Transylvania, Romania.

sections.text: Why visit Rosia Montana?

specificArticles.textContent:
1. 'Unique cultural landscape' - visit the protected area of Rosia Montana
The remains of the gold mining that started here since antiquity (galleries, stamp mills, artificial lakes) and the historic center with the heritage buildings made by the civilizations who came here to extract the gold (schools in different languages, multicultural churches or the goldsmith houses) can be visited through the following trails:

2. Discover the natural attractions from the area
The surroundings are also amazing, unpaved roads and footpaths connect us to the villages, mountain peaks, lakes and other objectives of the Apuseni Mountains (Carpathians). See the bellow trails (they can be also made by bike - you can rent one from Rosia).

3. See what would be the impact of a new mining open pit and how it looks the existing ones
Visit one of the biggest mining open pits from Europe: the Roșia Poieni open pit - 'Geamăna' trail and the Cetate open pit - 'Cârnic' trail. 'Corna' trail contains the area that should by covered by a cyanide wasting lake if a new gold mining would start.

sections.text: Accommodation, guided trails, bikes

specificArticles.textContent: We want to offer you an unique and authentic experience here in Rosia Montana, that's why we offer accommodation in the historic center and we put you in touch with the locals who make guided trails, traditional food or who rents bikes.
